hero.desc_main: Users aren't robots. See how I handle them in different kinds of projects, turning pain points into stunning, interactive screens and prototypes!

about.text: I think like an engineer, build like a developer, and see like a designer. Curious by nature, I’m always taking the world apart to understand how it ticks—whether it’s a system, a recipe, or those timeless screams that made rock history. Away from the screen: I sing, play, and vibe to classic rock. I keep my balance through working out, good food, and traveling. In the end, I create digital solutions while collecting stories worth telling.

projects.title: My Projects
projects.Project_1_desc: A portal can be an archive or an engine for transformation. This project investigates how UX can be the ignition for a culture of innovation, turning a simple information repository into a platform to empower 50,000 citizen-developers and democratize access to data.
projects.Project_2_desc: How is the DNA of a strong brand translated into a design language that scales to dozens of products without losing consistency? This project was the creation of that single source of truth: a Design System that encodes the brand's principles, foundation, and components to ensure that excellence is the standard, not the exception.
projects.Project_3_desc: What if the weakest link in data security—human access—could be completely removed? Vagalume 2.0 is a project about trust and efficiency, showing how a careful UX process was the key to building an interface that makes the complexity of AI simple and reliable.
projects.Project_4_desc: Behind every line of data in an HR system, there is a human journey. The challenge for SOMMOS was exactly this: how can design inject clarity, empathy, and simplicity into a universe of dense information and critical processes? This project reveals the power of UX to humanize technology and support decisions that impact thousands of lives.

about.title: ABOUT THE PROJECT
about.description: This project consists of the complete refactoring of the corporate technology portal, the "DigitalTech Portal", focusing on content centralization, learning, and automation with AI to optimize support in the Digital Tech area.

scenario.title: Current Scenario
scenario.description: The previous platform, called "AcademiaX", was developed without a structured UX/UI process, resulting in several problems such as decentralized information, lack of a structured learning portal, employee overload, and an inefficient user experience.

challenge.title: The Challenge
challenge.description: How to redesign the digital experience to centralize all technology initiatives, create a benchmark course portal, and develop support AIs that optimize employee time in an intuitive and scalable way?

designProcess.title: Design Process
designProcess.description: To ensure the solution was user-centered and aligned with business goals, I used the Double Diamond methodology, dividing the project into the stages of Discovery, Definition, Development, and Delivery.

user.title: Getting to Know the User
user.description: I conducted interviews and qualitative research with professionals from various areas to map their pain points, validating the need to automate support and centralize knowledge.

competitors.title: Competitor Analysis
competitors.description: I conducted a benchmarking analysis of other corporate learning platforms and data portals to identify best practices, interface patterns, and innovation opportunities.

udemy.name: Udemy
udemy.branch: B2C/B2B marketplace for courses on various topics.

alura.name: Alura
alura.branch: B2C/B2B subscription platform focused on technology.

weaknesses.1: ❌ Content not customized for the company

digitalTech.name: DigitalTech Portal
digitalTech.branch: Internal platform for education and knowledge management.

services.0: Courses focused on the company's stacks

solution.title: The Solution
solution.description: The final solution is a unified, intuitive, and functional portal. The front-end was built with React, Next.js, and Tailwind CSS for a fast and scalable experience. Before development, interactive prototypes in Figma were validated in three rounds of usability testing.
solution.warning: In compliance with the LGPD (General Data Protection Law) and to protect the company's identity, the screens and prototypes presented may have been altered in relation to the original project.

0.solution: The flow was validated with 100% success and should be maintained.

1.problem: Access to the "My Courses" area is only available through the main menu, requiring more clicks.
1.solution: Add a quick access CTA (Call to Action) to the user's home page.

2.problem: The certificates are in a sub-area, making their location unintuitive.
2.solution: Include a shortcut or direct CTA to the "Certificates" page on the user's main dashboard.

results.title: Results
results.description: The new portal successfully centralized information, and time savings were significant due to the support AIs. The creation of a structured course portal and easy access to the data catalog optimized processes and boosted internal training.

learnings.title: Key Learnings
learnings.description: This project reinforced the importance of basing a refactoring on research data. Validating hypotheses with usability tests was crucial to fix problems before development, saving time and resources. The migration of the tech stack was also a great opportunity for professional development.

about.title: ABOUT THE PROJECT
about.description: Broto is Suzano's official Design System, created to unify the visual and interaction language of all the company's digital products. I acted as a UX/UI Designer in the conception, prototyping, and technical alignment of the components.

scenario.title: Current Scenario
scenario.description: Before Broto, Suzano faced visual and experience inconsistencies across its various digital products. Each team developed its own components, leading to rework, high maintenance costs, and a fragmented brand identity.

challenge.title: The Challenge
challenge.description: How to create a scalable Design System, with the 'Suzano look', that standardizes the user experience, accelerates development, and is flexible enough to meet the needs of multiple products and teams?

designProcess.title: My Work Process
designProcess.description: My work focused on three pillars: Research (Discovery), Design (Prototyping), and Collaboration (Handoff). The goal was to ensure components were not only visually aligned but also technically feasible and reusable.

imageAlts.discovery: Diagram of the Design System creation process

user.title: Component Audit
user.description: I started with a complete audit of internal products. I mapped existing components (buttons, cards, modals) to identify patterns, inconsistencies, and the most urgent needs of the product teams.

competitors.title: Design Systems Benchmarking
competitors.description: I analyzed mature Design Systems in the market (like Material Design, Carbon, Atlassian) to understand best practices for documentation, versioning, and design token structure.

references.title: References and Inspirations
references.description: No system is created in a vacuum. Broto was heavily inspired by the best design and engineering practices from leading systems in the market.

mui.title: Material-UI (MUI)
mui.description: A reference for React components. MUI's well-defined component structure and extensive documentation served as the basis for our architecture.

tailwind.title: Tailwind CSS
tailwind.description: Inspiration for the 'utility-first' approach and the implementation of Design Tokens. It facilitated the creation of consistent, low-level styles.

lucide.title: Lucide Icons
lucide.description: Used as our main icon library. The consistency, lightness, and 'line-art' style of Lucide were perfect for Suzano's visual identity.

aggrid.title: AG Grid
aggrid.description: For complex data components (data grids), AG Grid was the reference for 'feature set' and performance, helping us define our own table components.

solution.title: The Solution: Figma Library
solution.description: The solution was the creation of a centralized library in Figma. I designed the components (atoms, molecules, organisms) based on the defined Design Tokens (colors, typography, spacing). I created high-fidelity prototypes to validate the use of components in real contexts before development.
solution.warning: In compliance with the LGPD and to protect the company's identity, the screens and prototypes presented may have been altered from the original project.
solution.finalImageAlt: Broto Design System components in Figma

0.problem: Developers had difficulty translating Figma to code (React/Tailwind).
0.solution: Creation of clear 'specs' documentation and 'design review' sessions with the front-end team.

1.problem: Color and font variations were being used outside the standard, breaking consistency.
1.solution: Implementation of Design Tokens in Figma and alignment for them to be the 'single source of truth' (SSoT).

2.problem: New product needs required component variations not foreseen in the DS.
2.solution: Definition of a governance process to propose, approve, and version new components in the DS.

results.title: Results
results.description: Broto began the standardization of Suzano's digital products, reducing design and development time. The Figma library became the 'single source of truth', improving collaboration between designers and developers and strengthening the brand identity.

learnings.title: Key Learnings
learnings.description: This project was a deep dive into systems creation. I learned the importance of governance (how the system evolves) and that a Design System is a living product, requiring constant maintenance and strong collaboration with engineering to ensure parity between design (Figma) and code (React).

about.title: ABOUT THE PROJECT
about.description: Vagalumen IA is an internal platform in partnership with Google, designed to democratize access to Gemini training data. The tool replaces complex queries in GCP with an intuitive, secure, and real-time prompt interface.

scenario.title: Current Scenario
scenario.description: Previously, access to Gemini training data was a bottleneck. The process required direct access to the Google Cloud Platform (GCP), SQL knowledge, and was time-consuming. Additionally, there were significant risks of sensitive information leaks, as access controls were complex to manage.

challenge.title: The Challenge
challenge.description: How could we create an interface that abstracts the complexity of GCP, allowing business users (non-technical) to access data securely and instantly, using only natural language (prompts)?

designProcess.title: My Process
designProcess.description: I worked on the entire product lifecycle, from experience design (UX) to implementation (Front-end). The focus was to translate a complex technical requirement (access to AI data) into a simple and secure user experience.

imageAlts.discovery: Diagram of the Design Thinking process applied to Vagalumen

user.title: User Interviews
user.description: I conducted interviews with data analysts and product managers (the target users) to map their frustrations with the current process (GCP/SQL) and validate the value hypotheses of a prompt-based interface.

competitors.title: Risk and Feasibility Analysis
competitors.description: I worked with the BI & Analytics team and Google specialists to understand the technical limitations of the Gemini API and security requirements. This was crucial for designing an interface that was both powerful and secure.

solution.title: The Solution: Secure Prompt Interface
solution.description: I designed a clean interface in Figma, focused on the prompt functionality. I created clickable prototypes that simulated the 'ask and receive' data interaction, which were used in usability tests to refine the flow. After validation, I coded the interface components in React, ensuring the design experience was implemented faithfully.
solution.warning: In compliance with non-disclosure agreements (NDA) with Google, the data, metrics, and names in the prototype have been altered to protect sensitive project information.

0.problem: Users tried to write very complex or technical prompts, similar to SQL, on first use.
0.solution: Added 'prompt examples' and 'placeholder text' to the UI to guide the user to use natural language.

1.problem: Users did not easily find the context menu
1.solution: Addition of context within the input field itself

2.problem: The flow to export the generated data (CSV) was not clear in the initial prototype.
2.solution: Refinement of the 'export button' design, making the action more explicit.

results.title: Results
results.description: Vagalumen IA transformed data access. The time to obtain insights was reduced from hours (sometimes days) to seconds. The platform eliminated the need for SQL training for business teams and mitigated security risks, becoming a strategic tool in the partnership with Google.

learnings.title: Key Learnings
learnings.description: This project was a challenge of translating a backend AI technology (Gemini) into a simple and intuitive frontend experience (React). My biggest learning was the importance of iterating quickly based on usability tests. Direct collaboration with AI engineers was essential to balance what was technically possible with what was humanly desirable for the user.

about.title: ABOUT THE PROJECT
about.description: SOMMOS is a robust HR data management system designed to connect the Human Resources team with employees, centralizing information on IDP (Individual Development Plan), CDP (Career Development Plan), positions, salaries, and evaluations.

scenario.title: Current Scenario
scenario.description: The HR team managed a large volume of employee data in decentralized systems and spreadsheets. Processes like IDP, evaluations, and succession plans were manual, leading to inconsistencies and making it difficult to visualize collective data.

challenge.title: The Challenge
challenge.description: How to create a unified platform that organizes this large volume of data, facilitates IDP/CDP management, and provides clear dashboards for HR, without overloading the user with information?

designProcess.title: My Work Process
designProcess.description: I worked in direct collaboration with a multidisciplinary team (HR, PO, Devs). My role spanned from discovery to delivery, focusing on designing screens, creating interactive prototypes, conducting usability tests, and discussing/arguing design solutions with stakeholders and the technical team.

user.title: Understanding the Stakeholders (HR)
user.description: I conducted interviews with the HR team (who were both users and stakeholders) to map pain points in managing IDP, CDP, and in visualizing individual and collective 'X-Rays'. The biggest issue was the difficulty in cross-referencing data.

competitors.title: Analysis of HR Tech Platforms
competitors.description: I analyzed performance and talent management systems on the market to understand how they handled complex data visualization (dashboards, evaluations) and development plans.

solution.title: The Solution: Integrated Talent Platform
solution.description: I designed a complete platform in Figma, with dedicated flows for IDP, CDP, individual/collective X-Ray, and an evaluations dashboard. The biggest design challenge was the dashboard, where the solution was to create visualizations that were not overwhelming, even with a large volume of data. The prototypes were validated in usability tests.
solution.warning: To protect confidential company information and employee data, the names, photos, and metrics in the prototype have been anonymized.

0.task: View leader evaluations by management area on the Dashboard.
0.solution: Keep the 'hover' interaction on the chart, which was well-received.

1.task: Use the AI suggestion to create an IDP item.
1.problem: The button to trigger the AI had low visibility and was poorly placed.
1.solution: Improve the location and visual prominence (color/size) of the AI button.

2.task: Identify in the Collective X-Ray who is eligible for succession in the team.
2.problem: Users could not identify the employees in the visualization.
2.solution: Add a 'tooltip' with employee names at the end of the page/chart.

results.title: Results
results.description: The SOMMOS system successfully centralized people management data. The IDP and CDP flows became more efficient, and the dashboards allowed HR to have a strategic view of evaluations and talent, which was previously impossible to obtain.

learnings.title: Key Learnings
learnings.description: This project was an intense exercise in multidisciplinary collaboration. My biggest learning was how to argue for and negotiate design solutions with stakeholders (who were also the users) and the development team, balancing usability needs with the technical constraints of a complex data system.
